title: Authors and Citation
text: Wais K, Banas M (2024). GitAI: Extracts Knowledge Git Repositories. R package version 0.0.0.9006.
code: @Manual{,   title = {GitAI: Extracts Knowledge From Git Repositories},   author = {Kamil Wais and Maciej Banas},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9006}, }

title: Extracts Knowledge From Git Repositories
text: goal GitAI derive knowledge GitHub GitLab repositories use AI/LLM (Large Language Models). GitAI can easily: set project scope (Git repositories), select content interest (files file types), choose LLM backend, define LLM prompts, process content repositories single function call. nice tidyverse style.

title: Extracts Knowledge From Git Repositories
text: can install development version GitAI GitHub :

title: Extracts Knowledge From Git Repositories
code: library(GitAI) # Set up project my_project <- initialize_project("fascinating_project") |>   set_github_repos(repos = c("r-world-devs/GitStats", "r-world-devs/GitAI", "openpharma/DataFakeR")) |>   add_files(files = "README.md") |>   set_llm() |>   set_prompt("Write one-sentence summary for a project based on given input.")  # Get the results results <- process_repos(my_project)
